listing the items that constitute "clothing"; and
that are consistent with the list of items that constitute "clothing" under the agreement.
"Coal-to-liquid" means the process of converting coal into a liquid synthetic fuel.
"Commercial use" means the use of gas, electricity, heat, coal, fuel oil, or other fuels that does not constitute industrial use under Subsection or residential use under Subsection .
"Common carrier" means a person engaged in or transacting the business of transporting passengers, freight, merchandise, or other property for hire within this state.

"Common carrier" does not include a person that, at the time the person is traveling to or from that person's place of employment, transports a passenger to or from the passenger's place of employment.
For purposes of Subsection , in accordance with Title , Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may make rules defining what constitutes a person's place of employment.
"Common carrier" does not include a person that provides transportation network services, as defined in Section .
"Component part" includes:
poultry, dairy, and other livestock feed, and their components;
baling ties and twine used in the baling of hay and straw;

fuel used for providing temperature control of orchards and commercial greenhouses doing a majority of their business in wholesale sales, and for providing power for off-highway type farm machinery; and
feed, seeds, and seedlings.
"Computer" means an electronic device that accepts information:
in digital form; or
in a form similar to digital form; and
manipulates that information for a result based on a sequence of instructions.
"Computer software" means a set of coded instructions designed to cause:
a computer to perform a task; or
automatic data processing equipment to perform a task.
"Computer software maintenance contract" means a contract that obligates a seller of computer software to provide a customer with:
future updates or upgrades to computer software;
support services with respect to computer software; or
a combination of Subsections and (b).
"Conference bridging service" means an ancillary service that links two or more participants of an audio conference call or video conference call.
"Conference bridging service" may include providing a telephone number as part of the ancillary service described in Subsection .
"Conference bridging service" does not include a telecommunications service used to reach the ancillary service described in Subsection .
"Construction materials" means any tangible personal property that will be converted into real property.
"Delivered electronically" means delivered to a purchaser by means other than tangible storage media.

by a seller of:
for preparation and delivery of the tangible personal property, product transferred electronically, or services described in Subsection to a location designated by the purchaser.
"Delivery charge" includes a charge for the following:
transportation;
shipping;
postage;
handling;
crating; or
packing.
"Detailed telecommunications billing service" means an ancillary service of separately stating information pertaining to individual calls on a customer's billing statement.

is intended to supplement the diet;
contains one or more of the following dietary ingredients:
a vitamin;
a mineral;
an herb or other botanical;
an amino acid;
a dietary substance for use by humans to supplement the diet by increasing the total dietary intake; or
a concentrate, metabolite, constituent, extract, or combination of any ingredient described in Subsections through (v);
except as provided in Subsection , is intended for ingestion in:
if the product is not intended for ingestion in a form described in Subsections through (F), is not represented:
is required to be labeled as a dietary supplement:
identifiable by the "Supplemental Facts" box found on the label; and
as required by 21 C.F.R. Sec. 101.36.

a water filtration system; or
a water softener system.

"Telecommunications enabling or facilitating equipment, machinery, or software" means an item listed in Subsection if that item is purchased or leased primarily to enable or facilitate one or more of the following to function:
telecommunications switching or routing equipment, machinery, or software; or
telecommunications transmission equipment, machinery, or software.
The following apply to Subsection :
a pole;
software;
a supplementary power supply;
temperature or environmental equipment or machinery;
test equipment;
a tower; or
equipment, machinery, or software that functions similarly to an item listed in Subsections through (vi) as determined by the commission by rule made in accordance with Subsection .

In accordance with Title , Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may by rule define what constitutes equipment, machinery, or software that functions similarly to an item listed in Subsections through (vi).
"Telecommunications equipment, machinery, or software required for 911 service" means equipment, machinery, or software that is required to comply with 47 C.F.R. Sec. 20.18.

"Telecommunications maintenance or repair equipment, machinery, or software" means equipment, machinery, or software purchased or leased primarily to maintain or repair one or more of the following, regardless of whether the equipment, machinery, or software is purchased or leased as a spare part or as an upgrade or modification to one or more of the following:
telecommunications enabling or facilitating equipment, machinery, or software;
telecommunications switching or routing equipment, machinery, or software; or
telecommunications transmission equipment, machinery, or software.
"Telecommunications service" means the electronic conveyance, routing, or transmission of audio, data, video, voice, or any other information or signal to a point, or among or between points.
"Telecommunications service" includes:
an electronic conveyance, routing, or transmission with respect to which a computer processing application is used to act:
an 800 service;
a 900 service;
a fixed wireless service;
a mobile wireless service;
a postpaid calling service;
a prepaid calling service;
a prepaid wireless calling service; or
a private communications service.
"Telecommunications service" does not include:
advertising, including directory advertising;
an ancillary service;
a billing and collection service provided to a third party;
a data processing and information service if:
installation or maintenance of the following on a customer's premises:
Internet access service;
a paging service;
a product transferred electronically, including:
a radio and television audio and video programming service:
a value-added nonvoice data service; or
tangible personal property.
"Telecommunications service provider" means a person that:
owns, controls, operates, or manages a telecommunications service; and
engages in an activity described in Subsection for the shared use with or resale to any person of the telecommunications service.
A person described in Subsection is a telecommunications service provider whether or not the Public Service Commission of Utah regulates:
that person; or
the telecommunications service that the person owns, controls, operates, or manages.
"Telecommunications switching or routing equipment, machinery, or software" means an item listed in Subsection if that item is purchased or leased primarily for switching or routing:
an ancillary service;
data communications;
voice communications; or
telecommunications service.
The following apply to Subsection :
a bridge;
a computer;
a cross connect;
a modem;
a multiplexer;
plug in circuitry;
a router;
software;
a switch; or
equipment, machinery, or software that functions similarly to an item listed in Subsections through (ix) as determined by the commission by rule made in accordance with Subsection .

In accordance with Title , Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may by rule define what constitutes equipment, machinery, or software that functions similarly to an item listed in Subsections through (ix).
"Telecommunications transmission equipment, machinery, or software" means an item listed in Subsection if that item is purchased or leased primarily for sending, receiving, or transporting:
an ancillary service;
data communications;
voice communications; or
telecommunications service.
The following apply to Subsection :
an amplifier;
a cable;
a closure;
a conduit;
a controller;
a duplexer;
a filter;
an input device;
an input/output device;
an insulator;
microwave machinery or equipment;
an oscillator;
an output device;
a pedestal;
a power converter;
a power supply;
a radio channel;
a radio receiver;
a radio transmitter;
a repeater;
software;
a terminal;
a timing unit;
a transformer;
a wire; or
equipment, machinery, or software that functions similarly to an item listed in Subsections through (xxv) as the commission determines by rule made in accordance with Subsection .

In accordance with Title , Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, the commission may by rule define what constitutes equipment, machinery, or software that functions similarly to an item listed in Subsections through (xxv).
"Textbook for a higher education course" means a textbook or other printed material that is required for a course:
offered by an institution of higher education; and
that the purchaser of the textbook or other printed material attends or will attend.
"Textbook for a higher education course" includes a textbook in electronic format.
"Tobacco" means:
a cigarette;
a cigar;
chewing tobacco;
pipe tobacco; or
any other item that contains tobacco.

"Unassisted amusement device" means an amusement device, skill device, or ride device that is started and stopped by the purchaser or renter of the right to use or operate the amusement device, skill device, or ride device.

"Use" means the exercise of any right or power over tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service under Subsection , incident to the ownership or the leasing of that tangible personal property, product transferred electronically, or service.

"Use" does not include the sale, display, demonstration, or trial of tangible personal property, a product transferred electronically, or a service in the regular course of business and held for resale.
"Value-added nonvoice data service" means a service:

that otherwise meets the definition of a telecommunications service except that a computer processing application is used to act primarily for a purpose other than conveyance, routing, or transmission; and
with respect to which a computer processing application is used to act on data or information:
code;
content;
form; or
protocol.
Subject to Subsection , "vehicle" means the following that are required to be titled, registered, or titled and registered:
an aircraft as defined in Section ;
a vehicle as defined in Section ;
an off-highway vehicle as defined in Section ; or
a vessel as defined in Section .
For purposes of Subsection only, "vehicle" includes:
a vehicle described in Subsection ; or
"Vehicle dealer" means a person engaged in the business of buying, selling, or exchanging a vehicle as defined in Subsection .
"Vertical service" means an ancillary service that:
is offered in connection with one or more telecommunications services; and
offers an advanced calling feature that allows a customer to:
"Vertical service" includes an ancillary service that allows a customer to manage a conference bridging service.
"Voice mail service" means an ancillary service that enables a customer to receive, send, or store a recorded message.
"Voice mail service" does not include a vertical service that a customer is required to have in order to utilize a voice mail service.
"Waste energy facility" means a facility that generates electricity:
using as the primary source of energy waste materials that would be placed in a landfill or refuse pit if it were not used to generate electricity, including:
in amounts greater than actually required for the operation of the facility.
"Waste energy facility" does not include a facility that incinerates:
hospital waste as defined in 40 C.F.R. 60.51c; or
medical/infectious waste as defined in 40 C.F.R. 60.51c.
"Watercraft" means a vessel as defined in Section .
"Wind energy" means wind used as the sole source of energy to produce electricity.
"ZIP Code" means a Zoning Improvement Plan Code assigned to a geographic location by the United States Postal Service.
